title: Business Live: new Apple range - BBC News
summary: sterling hits 2017 high against us dollar .
fox/sky deal set to be referred to competition regulator .
uk inflation rises to 2.9 % in august .
jd sports sales jump in first half .

documents.title: good night
text: and that 's it for this evening .
thanks for reading business live and do join us if you can tomorrow from 0600 .

documents.title: a galaxy even further away
text: disney has pushed back the release of star wars : episode ix by seven months to december 2019 after changing directors for the film .
the force awakens filmmaker jj abrams ( will return to a galaxy far , far away to replace colin trevorrow as the director of the next instalment .
trevorrow , who made jurassic world , parted company with the film last week .
abrams will co-write the film with chris terrio , as well as directing .
abrams delivered a huge box office success with episode vii the force awakens in 2015 , which took more than $ 2bn worldwide .
episode viii the last jedi , which will be released in cinemas on 14 december this year , was directed by rian johnson .

documents.title: wall street hits fresh record
text: the three major us indexes have closed at record highs , even though gains were stunted by the decline in apple shares .
the s & p 500 index rose 0.3 % to 2,496.48 , while the dow jones industrial average also rose 0.3 % , to 22,118.86 .
the nasdaq composite finished 22 points higher at 6,454.28 .
investors are feeling more optimistic because hurricane irma was less powerful than feared in florida , and further missile tests by north korea did n't materialise over the weekend .

documents.title: apple shares dip
text: shares in apple finished 0.4 % lower after it unveiled the iphone x handset , having earlier risen 1 % .
a bit of profit taking , or an early verdict on the new handset ?

documents.title: do the ballmer
text: guardian reporter rob davies points out this rival to that somewhat bizarre jack ma video :
every so often i watch this video of former microsoft ceo steve ballmer , just to give myself a mid-afternoon lift .

documents.title: jack son ?
text: this video of alibaba boss jack ma at the company 's annual `` party '' is probably the weirdest thing i 've seen this year , as new york business correspondent michelle fleury tweets :
jack ma celebrated alibaba 's annual party performing a michael jackson dance number .
tim cook , your move # appleevent

documents.title: crozier takes to the silver screen
text: former itv boss adam crozier will become chairman of cinema chain vue international as the company considers a sale or ipo , the financial times ' murad ahmed reports .

mr crozier said : i have watched the development and growth of vue international with great interest and am excited to be joining the group to play an active role in furthering their future ambitions . ''
vue is owned by two canadian pension funds , which acquired the company in 2013 for £ 935m .

documents.title: dimon slams bitcoin
text: jpmorgan chief executive jamie dimon has attacked bitcoin , calling the digital currency `` a fraud '' that will blow up sooner or later .
`` the currency is n't going to work .
you ca n't have a business where people can invent a currency out of thin air and think that people who are buying it are really smart , '' he told an investor conference in new york .
`` it 's worse than tulip bulbs - it wo n't end well .
if we had a trader who traded bitcoin i 'd fire him in a second for two reasons .
it is against our rules and they are stupid , and both are dangerous . ''
mr dimon also predicted big losses for bitcoin buyers : `` do n't ask me to short it .
it could be at $ 20,000 before this happens , but it will eventually blow up .
honestly , i am just shocked that anyone ca n't see it for what it is . ''

documents.title: another great era ?
text: it 's the big ( ger ) leap that iphone fans - and wall street - had been demanding .

the iphone x - ten '' , not x '' - brings together many features we 'd been expecting - such as faceid for unlocking the phone , and animated emojis - animojis - that look fun to play with , if not a killer feature that 'll have people running to stores .
all this wo n't come cheap : at $ 999 - or £ 999 in the uk - it 's the most expensive iphone to date .
apple is often accused of being slow to new tech , and i think that criticism will continue .

wireless charging comes years after samsung first introduced it , for example , and the overall look of the phone , which no longer has the iconic home button , looks strikingly similar to the latest samsung galaxy note .
the phone was unveiled in the new steve jobs theater , a purpose-built venue or such launches .
a beautiful , comfy building , with marble everywhere , it sits alongside apple 's striking new spaceship campus .
this is the house that iphone built , with a decade of phenomenal success .
does iphone x herald another great era ?
the audience here cheered , but did n't stand , with applause .
i 'm reserving my judgement until i 've tried it .
author: Dave Lee
North America technology reporter

documents.title: apple reveals 'leap forward ' iphone x
text: apple 's new iphone x - which is referred to as `` ten '' - uses a facial recognition system to recognise its owner rather than a fingerprint-based one .
faceid can work in the dark by using 30,000 infra-red dots to check an identity , apple says , and is harder to fool than its old touchid system .
the firm has yet to reveal the cost but analysts predict it will be the first mainstream handset to be priced above $ 1,000/£ 1,000 .
apple also unveiled the lower-end iphone 8 and iphone 8 plus , which are its first to feature in-built wireless charging .
read our full story here .

documents.title: never mind the price tag
text: it wo n't come cheap : the iphone 8 starts at $ 699 for the 64gb model and $ 799 for the 8 plus .
orders start on 15 september and ships on 22 september for the 8 and 8 plus .
there will also be wireless charging as standard .

documents.title: 'huge step forward '
text: the new iphone contains the first chip apple has itself designed - the a11 bionic chip .
the 8 has a 4.7 inch display , while the 8 plus has a 5.5 inch screen .
both have a new glass-body design and other improvements .
apple chief executive tim cook said they represent `` a huge step forward '' for the california technology giant , which is marking the 10th anniversary of the iphone .

documents.title: hammond defends hinkley
text: the chancellor , philip hammond , has said the government does not need a `` major review '' of the new hinkley point nuclear plant .

lord turnbull - a former head of the civil service - asked if ministers should look again at the original approval for the plant , given the falling cost of offshore wind , edf 's problems and the collapse of the nuclear build industry .
but mr hammond says he `` would disagree '' enough has changed since the 2013 approval to warrant a major re-examination of the £ 20bn project .
author: Dan Macadam
BBC business reporter

documents.title: breakingbell pottinger in administration
text: bdo has been appointed as administrators to bell pottinger , the embattled pr firm that was kicked out of its trade body last week .
a bdo spokesman said : following an immediate assessment of the financial position , the administrators have made a number of redundancies .

the administrators are now working with the remaining partners and employees to seek an orderly transfer of bell pottinger 's clients to other firms in order to protect and realise value for creditors .
we have taken appropriate steps to preserve the rights bell pottinger may have in relation to the failure of the business . ''
the entities in administration are bell pottinger private ltd , bell pottinger llp and bell pottinger services ltd .
no subsidiaries outside the uk is in administration and they continue to trade under the control of their separate management teams , bdo added .

documents.title: sky 'disappointed '
text: sky shares ended the day 1.6 % lower at 937p following karen bradley 's announcement earlier about the fox takeover bid .

a spokesman for sky said : `` we are disappointed by this further delay and that the secretary of state is now minded to refer the proposed acquisition to the cma in relation to broadcasting standards despite ofcom , as the independent broadcast regulator , maintaining its advice that there are not sufficient concerns to justify such a reference .
nevertheless we will continue to engage with the process as the secretary of state reaches her final decision . ''

documents.title: hmrc looking at 'no deal ' scenario
text: philip hammond tells the lords that hmrc is looking at the outcome on customs if the uk fails to strike a deal with the european union when it leaves .
the chancellor says the customs agency is working on all eventualities , including such a `` no deal '' scenario .
`` we recognise that the timescales are very challenging , and in a no-deal scenario , not everything we would want to put in place will be in place on day one .
but we will have a working system in place on day one , i have that assurance from hmrc , '' he says .
author: Dan Macadam
BBC business reporter

documents.title: have new strike laws made a difference ?
text: len mccluskey , leader of the unite union , has said he would support members taking illegal strike action in contravention of the new trade union laws .

it 's been just over six months since two extra thresholds were introduced , requiring at least a 50 % turnout in strike ballots and at least 40 % of eligible members to vote in favour of strike action in certain key services .

there have been a few examples of strikes not going ahead as a result of the laws , including the rmt ballot on london underground , which was 80 % in favour of strike action but with only a 34 % turnout .
it is also likely that the rules will change behaviour , with unions less likely to ballot members if they are not confident of getting a 50 % turnout .
in terms of working days lost to industrial action , 90,000 were lost in the first four months after the law was changed .
that is relatively low for a four-month period .
the average in the last decade was 177,000 .
but it 's not a record low : in the same four months of 2015 only 50,000 days were lost .
author: Reality Check

documents.title: hammond : firms need brexit clarity
text: the chancellor is facing members of the lords in his first committee hearing since the snap election in june .
the lords economic affairs committee is grilling him on the government 's brexit plans and the impact it is having on the economy .
the times economics editor philip aldrick out some of the highlights
hammond says the economy was in a good place in early 2016 , before brexit .
need deal clarity asap to get back to that
hammond says `` the general agrmt '' in govt is that migration arrangements during transition period would look like now .
he says `` it would not make sense for business to make two sets of changes ''

documents.title: labour market warning
text: speaking of brexit , imposing immigration curbs after leaving the european union will result in a `` labour market supply shock '' and lead to higher automation and job offshoring rather than higher wages for british workers , a hard-hitting report from deutsche bank warns .

macro strategist oliver harvey and chief economist mark wall say there is little to support the `` familiar brexit narrative '' that a fall in immigration will force companies to `` pay up '' for domestic workers , particularly in low-skilled industries .
`` while attractive for its simplicity , this narrative ignores some important considerations , '' the deutsche report says .
`` the first is the link between productivity and wages .
wages can not be raised sustainably above productivity without higher inflation .
otherwise , the labour costs of businesses will rise at the expense of profits . ''

the report says that japan in particular should `` serve as a warning '' for those who believe a tighter labour market should automatically raise wages , noting that employers there had reduced hours rather than paying workers more .

documents.title: brexit talks delayed ?
text: diplomats in brussels said the european union and britain had agreed to delay the next round of brexit talks on expectations that theresa may will make an important speech on the subject on 21 september .
the next round will now begin 25 september rather than 18 september , which one source told reuters was `` for reasons of britain 's political calendar '' .
another source said britain asked for the delay to let mrs may set out her latest views and plans on brexit before more negotiations .
however , the prime minister 's spokeswoman said nothing had yet been formally agreed about moving the date .

documents.title: 'insider trading '
text: a us senator has called for a criminal probe of actions taken by equifax executives after a massive data breach this summer , saying their actions were comparable to insider trading .

senator heidi heitkamp ( a north dakota democrat who sits on the senate banking committee , said it was `` disturbing '' that it appeared executives sold nearly $ 2m worth of shares in the period between learning of the hack and making it public .
`` if that happened , somebody needs to go to jail , '' she told a conference in washington dc .
`` it 's a problem when people can act with impunity with no consequences .
how is that not insider trading ? ''
equifax said last week that the executives were not aware of the breach when they sold their shares .
meanwhile , senator gary peters , a michigan democrat , called on the federal trade commission to launch its own equifax probe .

to whom ?
where would they find all these workers when unemployment is 4.5 %
to the workers of course migrants & nationals
only 4 in 100 are unemployed .
so if all migrants went home , how are you going to replace them ?
this is why uk politics sucks , both main parties seemingly ca n't understand that two things can be true at the same time .
thank god someone sees the blatantly obvious .
migrants do n't cause low wages , but they enable employers to keep them low .
unscrupulous employers were bashing serfs before black death - was it a labour gov that caused a softer approach ?

documents.title: wall street rises
text: wall street is trading higher , with the dow jones industrial average up 0.3 % at 22,117.2 and the s & p 500 advancing 0.2 % to a new record of 2,493.7 points .
the nasdaq composite is up 0.1 % to 6,439.2 points .
dowdupont rose 2.7 % after confirming it was on target to save $ 4bn following the completion of its merger .
the chemicals giant also tweaked its plan to restructure into three companies to try to placate some shareholder activists critical of the original plan .
goldman sachs rose 1.7 % after setting out plans to boost profitability by $ 2.5bn over the next three years - partly by hiring more staff in fixed income and currencies trading .

documents.title: 'playing with fire '
text: bankrupt air berlin has cancelled dozens of flights after `` an exceptionally high number '' of pilots called in sick , prompting the airline to accuse staff of sabotaging rescue talks .

chief executive thomas winkelmann said employees were `` playing with fire '' with their apparent protest action , which comes ahead of a friday deadline for interested bidders to submit offers to take over parts of germany 's second-largest airline .
air berlin said some 200 of its 1,500 pilots had suddenly called in sick , forcing the scrapping of about 100 flights on both domestic and international routes .
mr winkelmann said : `` we are in the middle of final negotiations with potential investors .
stable operations are a prerequisite for the success of these negotiations .
that 's the only way we can secure as many jobs as possible . ''
air berlin filed for bankruptcy in mid-august , after its main shareholder , the gulf carrier etihad , unexpectedly pulled the plug on its cash lifeline .

documents.title: trump tax trouble ahead ?
text: staying stateside for a moment , we wonder if this is the sound of another reverse ferret from donald trump .
the us president has said he wants to cut the corporate tax rate to 15 % , but treasury secretary steven mnuchin said today : `` ideally , he 'd like to get it down to 15 % .
i do n't know if we 'll be able to achieve that given the budget issues , but we 're going to get this down to a very competitive level . ''

documents.title: breakings & p record
text: the s & p 500 - the main us stock market index - has risen above 2,490.87 points for the first time to hit a record high as trading begins in new york .

documents.title: mean machine
text: business correspondent theo leggett tweets from the frankfurt motor show :
the star of the frankfurt show - the f1-engined mercedes project one hypercar .
it 's also a hybrid .

documents.title: 'she 's a good 'un '
text: shadow culture secretary tom watson has welcomed karen bradley 's decision to refer fox 's bid on broadcasting standards grounds as well as on media plurality grounds .

`` i think it 's the first time a minister in the current government has ever stood in the way of what the murdochs want , and frankly not before time , so well done , and as they say in the black country , she 's a good 'un , '' he told the commons .
`` she 's done everything we asked her to do .
or almost everything .
her statement does , however , reflect in my view a failure on the part of ofcom . ''

documents.title: 'foxification ' fears
text: more from culture secretary karen bradley ( in the commons , who told mps that concerns were also raised about the `` foxification '' of fox-owned news outlets internationally .
on the evidence before me i am not able to conclude that this raises non-fanciful concerns .

however , i consider it important that entities which adopt controversial or partisan approaches to news and current affairs in other jurisdictions should , at the same time , have a genuine commitment to broadcasting standards here .
these are matters the cma may wish to consider in the event of a referral . ''

documents.title: bradley elaborates on sky decision
text: culture secretary karen bradley says she intends to ask the competition and markets authority ( cma ) to conduct a fuller investigation into 21st century fox 's £ 11.7bn bid for the share of sky that it does not already own on the grounds of media plurality .
she added she is also now minded to refer the merger to the cma on the grounds of `` genuine commitment to broadcasting standards '' .
ms bradley took advice from the watchdog ofcom and heard representations from the parties involved .

she said : `` i have taken careful account of all relevant representations and ofcom 's advice and have today - as required by the legislation - written to the parties to inform them i am now minded to refer the merger to the cma on the grounds of genuine commitment to broadcasting standards . ''

documents.title: how much could lifting the pay cap cost ?
text: the government has decided to lift the 1 % pay cap on the public sector , although at the moment we do n't know by how much , except for the police and prison officers .
how much it would cost is a tricky question .
in the case of the police and prison officers , the money is apparently coming from existing budgets , but that means that there will have to be cuts elsewhere or reserves will be run down .

the institute for fiscal studies reckons that an extra 1 % pay for the entire public sector would cost about £ 1.8bn a year , although it would get some of that back in income tax and national insurance .

but there are other savings that need to be taken into account , for example , some have argued that raising pay in the nhs would stop staff leaving and reduce absence , so reducing the use of more expensive agency staff and saving money .
author: Reality Check

documents.title: sky shares fall
text: shares in sky are trading 2.68 % lower at 927p following a statement by culture secretary karen bradley that she is minded to refer 21st century fox 's £ 11.7bn bid to take full control of the satellite broadcaster to the competition and markets authority .

documents.title: breakingbradley intends to refer sky deal
text: culture secretary karen bradley has told mps she is minded to refer 21st century fox 's £ 11.7bn bid for sky to the competition regulator for further investigation .

documents.title: bmw : we need free trade after brexit
text: at this year 's frankfurt motor show , manufacturers forging ahead with new plans for more electric vehicles .
the other key issue is trade between the eu and uk after brexit - as bmw chief executive harald krueger told the bbc 's theo leggett .

documents.title: ai the 'perfect tool ' for hackers
text: artificial intelligence is the perfect tool for hackers , says this slightly scary piece from gizmodo .
it quotes brian wallace , cylance lead security data scientist .
he says : hackers have been using artificial intelligence as a weapon for quite some time . ''

it makes total sense because hackers have a problem of scale , trying to attack as many people as they can , hitting as many targets as possible , and all the while trying to reduce risks to themselves .
artificial intelligence , and machine learning in particular , are perfect tools to be using on their end . ''

documents.title: breakinggovernment to end public sector pay cap
text: number 10 says public sector pay cap will end from 2018/19 .
ministers will show `` flexibility '' in next pay round

documents.title: all-male line-up for science and tech committeebusiness insider uk tweets
text: there are no women in the government 's new science and technology committee
i would hope the best people have been chosen regardless of their gender

documents.title: welsh tech firm shares soar on iphone link
text: you probably have n't head of iqe , but it 's made some investors very happy this year .
the stock is up around 300 % in 2017 .
that rise has been fuelled by speculation iqe products might be needed by apple for use in its new iphone .
the cardiff based company supplies the computer chip industry with wafers ( the silicon type , not the biscuit type ) .
those wafers are for needed 3d sensors .
those sensors can be used for facial recognition - a feature expected to be included in the latest iphone to be revealed this evening .
we 'll check back in tomorrow on the shares and see if investors are still excited .

documents.title: breakingsellafield workers to strike over pay
text: workers at the sellafield nuclear site will go on strike on 27 september , according to the gmb union , in a dispute over a 1.5 % pay rise .

gmb official chris jukes said : '' no-one likes to take strike action but gmb members have been given a pay cut , on top of a 0.25 % increase last year , and their pay has failed to keep up with rising prices .
`` like everyone else , gmb members have bills to pay . ''

documents.title: 'sick ' pilots ground air berlin flights
text: air berlin , the insolvent airline group , has been forced to cancel 100 flights on tuesday after around 200 pilots called in sick .
the company is trying to find a buyer for the business and its chief operating officer oliver iffert said in a staff memo : `` we must return to stable operations .
that is crucial in order to bring talks with investors to a successful conclusion .
`` today is a day that threatens the existence of air berlin . ''
reuters reports that the pilots union , vereinigung cockpit , was surprised by the absences and that it had not called on its members at air berlin to call in sick .

documents.title: statement on fox sky deal at 13:30
text: around 13:30 bst britain 's media secretary karen bradley will make a statement to parliament over the bid by rupert murdoch 's 21st century fox for sky .
ms bradley has been considering whether to refer the deal to uk competition authorities for an in-depth investigation .
at the end of june she said she was `` minded '' to refer the deal .

documents.title: east midlands housing market heats up
text: personal finance reporter kevin peachey tweets :
eh !
up me duck !
east mids sees fastest house price and rent rises @ twitterid thoughts # nottingham # derby # leicester ?

documents.title: watch : was your t-shirt made in north korea ?
text: north korea 's textile industry is the latest to come under un sanctions - so how big a sector is it ?
the bbc 's karishma vaswani takes a look .

documents.title: keep that noise down !
text: the bbc 's theo leggett is at the frankfurt motor show .
so far , it has been a mixed experience
dear car firms - we can admire your amazing machines without thumping techno at 100db .
really .
i now have a headache & tinnitus # iaa2017
who left the car on the roof ?
modern living concept from renault - more on this later .
this is what toyota thinks will be powering our cars in future .
pass the hydrogen !
# mirai at # iaa2017
i ca n't see it myself .
i think this will end up being the betamax option .
agreed .
h2 for cars is a disaster .
diesel cars are cleaner !
only oil companies love h2 as they can keep drilling
problem for a toyota is they 've already invested heavily in fuel cell tech , so they have to keep pushing it .
well , paying £ 50 for a tank of h2 vs £ 7 in electric ( at home ) among other big h2 problems should sort it !
h2 good for trains , little else .

documents.title: ftse 100 heads lower
text: the ftse 100 is now trading lower following the rise in the pound on higher inflation figures for august .
the blue chip index is down 10.41 points at 7,403.18 .
equipment hire group ashtead continues to lead the risers , up 8 % at £ 18.19 , on expectations of increased business following the hurricanes in the us .
whitbread is still the biggest loser , down 2.4 % at £ 36.83 .

documents.title: unite : co-ordinated strike action 'on the cards '
text: unite boss calls for co-ordinated pay strikes
@ twitterid the future for uk post brexit and what can unions do about it ?
@ francesogrady @ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: apple by night
text: how 's this for dedication .
the bbc 's north america technology reporter dave lee is eagerly awaiting the launch of apple 's new iphone and has tweeted the following arty night shots .
a few night time shots from # applepark this evening .
how long until an employee camps in the woods ?
contract employees for sure
cool , it 's the latest photo of the jobs theater

documents.title: bank may remain split on interest rate
text: capital economics is predicting a split within the bank of england 's monetary policy committee ( mpc ) when it meets this week to discuss the interest rate .

uk economist paul hollingsworth says : `` [ the ] figures are likely to provide further ammunition to the more hawkish members of the mpc at this thursday 's meeting , and as a result we expect the vote to be split once again . ''

but he adds : `` with mixed signals on the current strength of the economy and the majority of the committee appearing to be comfortable with a temporary , exchange-rate driven in headline inflation , we do n't think that the mpc will be panicked into raising interest rates imminently . ''

documents.title: rent rates slow for london landlords
text: landlords in london are not getting as much out of their tenants as they previously had .
figures from the ons show that rental prices in the capital rose by 1.2 % in the year to august compared to 1.5 % in the 12 months to july .
apart from the north east , london was the worst performer last month .
in contrast , the east midlands recorded the largest rise in rent rates , up 2.8 % .

documents.title: redrow shares slump on chairman sale
text: shares in redrow , the housebuilder , fell by 7.43 % to 585.50p after its chairman and founder steve morgan sold a large stake in the business .
he has sold 7 % of his holding in redrow but he will continue to hold around 33 % of the company .

documents.title: what now for the interest rate ?
text: will the inflation figures on tuesday prompt an interest rate rise from the bank of england on thursday ?
etx capital senior market analyst neil wilson thinks not .
but it could speed things up .
he says : `` the inflation data builds a stronger case for the bank of england to look at hiking rates but it is not yet strong enough for the monetary policy committee to act this week . ''

`` whilst this inflation report is unlikely to mean the monetary policy committee votes for a rate hike thursday , it does increase the prospect of interest rates raising sooner than the market currently anticipates . ''

documents.title: rental price growth slows in august
text: the price of renting a home in the uk slowed in august , according to the office for national statistics .
private rental prices paid by tenants rose by 1.6 % in the 12 months to august , compared to 1.8 % in the year to july .

documents.title: pound hits high for 2017
text: the pound pushed higher after those inflation figures .
it traded as high as $ 1.3271 , its best level for the year against the dollar .

documents.title: has uk inflation hit its peak ?
text: this from ben brettell , senior economist , at hargreaves lansdown .
`` inflation ticked up again in august this will inevitably raise questions about the uk 's ongoing cost of living squeeze .
`` data released tomorrow is expected to show pay increasing at 2.2 % in the three months to july , meaning wages are still shrinking in real terms .
`` yet it looks likely that inflation will fall back in the coming months , as the effect of brexit-induced sterling weakness falls out of the year-on-year calculation .
indeed it 's possible that 2.9 % will be the highest we see in the current cycle . ''

documents.title: peugeot boss on opel deal
text: back in march peugeot bought the opel business , which includes vauxhall .
the bbc 's theo leggett is at the frankfurt auto show and has been speaking to peugeot 's boss .
psa boss tavares says opel will make money by giving employees 'freedom ' .
admits they may be concerned about their jobs , too # iaa2017

documents.title: english houses fuel price growth
text: the ons says that the average house price was £ 226,000 in july , which is £ 11,000 higher compared to the same month last year and up £ 2,000 on june .
england recorded the largest increase in house prices , with the average price rising by 5.4 % to £ 243,000 in the year to july .
homeowners in wales saw a rise of 3.1 % , to an average £ 151,000 .
in scotland , prices grew by 4.8 % to £ 149,000 while in northern ireland , they rose by 4.4 % to £ 129,000 .

documents.title: inflation driven by clothing
text: the average price of clothing and footwear rose 2.4 % between july and august of this year , that was much stronger than last year .
the ons says it may reflect that fewer items were on sale this year .
women 's clothing in particular saw price rises .
the annual rate of increase in clothing is 4.6 % , the highest since the cpih series of figures began in january 2006 .

documents.title: breakinghouse prices rise by 5.1 %
text: house prices rose by 5.1 % in the year to july , according to the office for national statistics .

documents.title: breakinguk inflation hits 2.9 % in august
text: uk inflation rose in august according to the office for national statistics .
cpi was at 2.9 % compared to 2.6 % in july .

documents.title: have we hit peak coffee ?
text: whitbread shares are down almost 3 % , making them one of the biggest losers on the ftse 100 .
the owner of coffee chain costa and premier inns has seen its shares suffer a double downgrade by analysts at citi .
they now rate them a `` sell '' rating , having previously labelled them `` buy '' .
why the gloom ?
well it says the sharing economy , that 's people renting rooms on websites like airbnb , is having an impact on the company 's outlook .
meanwhile citi says there is just four and half years growth in the uk coffee chain market .

documents.title: japan stocks gains as north korea tensions ease
text: japanese shares made solid gains on tuesday as north korea tensions eased and investors took note of strong rises on the us markets on monday .
japan 's nikkei rose by 1.2 % , up 230.85 points , to 19,776.62 , boosted by financial stocks .
the south korea kospi index also increased , up 6.39 points at 2,365.47 .
the united nations security council unanimously stepped up sanctions against north korea on monday over the country 's sixth and most powerful nuclear test .
hong kong 's hang seng , however , was muted and added just 8.80 points to close at 27,963.93 .

documents.title: unite boss willing to break law to go on strike
text: unite boss willing to break law to go on strike
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: britain seeks helping hand from trump
text: just how `` special '' is the special relationship between the us and the uk ?
it is being put to the test right now after prime minister theresa may phoned president trump to seek his help in resolving a trade dispute that threatens jobs at bombardier in belfast .
read the full story here .

documents.title: ashtead leads the ftse 100 higher
text: with a 4.8 % jump , ashtead is the biggest winner among ftse 100 shares .
the equipment hire group expects a surge in business following hurricanes harvey and irma in the united states .
overall the ftse 100 was few points higher at 7,422 .
on the ftse 250 jd sports has jumped 9 % after its blockbuster results .

documents.title: wood group gets go-ahead for amec deal
text: the £ 2.2bn takeover of amec foster wheeler by wood group has been given the green light by the uk 's competition watchdog .

the competition and markets authority said that it has accepted remedies put forward by both of the oil and gas companies after it raised concerns about the supply of engineering and construction services , as well as operation and maintenance services in the north sea .
the deal is expected to complete in october .

documents.title: ashtead to benefit from us hurricanes
text: equipment hire group ashtead expects an upturn in business following hurricanes harvey and irma in the us .

reporting strong first quarter results , chief executive geoff drabble says : `` hurricane season has already generated significant activity which will require a major clean-up effort and then a multi-year rebuild programme .
`` currently , our efforts are focussed on supporting our colleagues , neighbours and customers and we stand ready to provide further assistance . ''
while he says it is too early `` to quantify the impact of hurricanes harvey and irma accurately on our business '' , he expects demand for its services to up .

documents.title: hastings : talks with aa have ceased
text: insurance group hastings has now issued a statement on talks with the aa .
it says : `` the board confirms that the company did have preliminary discussions with the aa regarding a potential partnership with its insurance division , which have ceased .
`` whilst hastings regularly reviews selective acquisition opportunities , its core strategy remains to deliver on its organic growth and its disclosed targets . ''

documents.title: sunrise at virgin money
text: sunrise on the virgin money boardroom , formerly # northernrock hq - with @ twitterid for @ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: death , taxes and another banking crisis
text: if there is one thing that is certain in life - apart from death and taxes - is another banking crisis , says professor kevin dowd of durham university .
`` banking crisis never go away , it 's just a case of when the next one hits and how severe it will be .
`` the only thing we can do is to ensure that our banks are sufficiently capitalised and that is something the bank of england has failed to do . ''
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: all is not well for uk banks
text: so a decade after the collapse of northern rock , everything is hunky-dory .
is n't it ?
not so , says kevin dowd , professor of finance and economics at durham university .
he says : `` the capital improvements at the banks are largely illusory . ''
he tells bbc today : `` if you look at the book value capital , that has gone up by 25 % .
if you look at market value capital , it has gone down by about a third so that means that banks are more leveraged now than they were going into the crisis .
`` what the markets are saying is that they do no believe the book values of the banks .
they believe that the banks are carrying hidden losses that are not revealed in their accounts . ''
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: aa confirms hastings proposal
text: aa has admitted that it did hold talks about spinning off its insurance division and merging it with rival hastings .
it said : `` the aa regularly reviews all strategic options , including whether a spin-off of any of its business lines would unlock further value and be in its shareholders ' interests .
`` we confirm that we did have preliminary discussions with hastings in early summer to explore a possible combination of the aa 's insurance business with hastings . ''

documents.title: jd sports sprints ahead
text: jd sports has reported a stonking 41 % increase in sales for the half-year to 29 july .
pre-tax profit was up 33 % at £ 102.7m .
it expects full-year results to be at the `` upper end '' of market expectations .
the sportswear retailer has been expanding rapidly , adding an extra 12 stores in the uk and ireland and 23 stores in europe .

documents.title: how not to hold an off-site strategy meeting
text: the financial times has some intriguing details on the firing of aa chairman bob mackenzie in july .
the ft says there was a `` late-night physical altercation '' between mr mackenzie and the boss of the the aa 's insurance business , michael lloyd , in the bar of a country hotel .
they were supposed to be discussing strategy for the insurance business .

however , mr mackenzie 's legal team says the incident was used by aa management to push him out , because he was opposed to the company 's plan to merge the insurance business with rival hastings group .

documents.title: travel disruption due to french strikes
text: simon calder is the independent 's travel editor .
french air-traffic control strike in progress `` very high delays '' in marseille sector , covering a swathe of the south

documents.title: the financial crisis in a nutshell
text: former northern rock chief executive gary hoffman explains risky deals that northern rock was making ten years ago .
`` famously , or infamously , it lent these together '' mortgages .

these were those 125 % mortgages that everyone felt was quite risky but even northern rock would n't lend to some customers and for those customers that it regarded as too risky then it gave a lead to lehmans - lehmans subsequently crashed of course .

`` lehmans lent the money for these high risk customers and then what happened is that lehmans packaged those mortgages up into those so-called asset-backed securities and northern rock treasury bought them back .
so there is the financial crisis . ''

documents.title: oil on the fire
text: france 's president emmanuel macron will today face his first major challenge to his plans to change the country 's notoriously restrictive employment laws .
some 180 street protests are planned nationwide against the reforms .
france 's biggest trade union , the cgt , is leading calls for 4,000 strikes .

mr macron probably did n't help matters by referring to people who oppose the changes as `` slackers '' - a remark , described by bruno cautres of the cevipof political research institute as throwing `` oil on the fire '' .

documents.title: what went wrong at northern rock
text: gary hoffman , the man who was parachuted in to take charge of northern rock after it collapsed 10 years ago , is looking back at what went wrong for the bank .

he tells bbc today : `` what i found in northern rock was a chronic failing of leadership as well as a poor business model but it was a culture where people would not speak up even though they knew things were going wrong . ''
he says now that banks are safer , they are better capitalised and that it would require more extreme conditions for another northern rock to happen .
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: business pages on tuesday
text: the telegraph business section says that apple faces `` one of its most challenging product launches in years '' , when it rolls out the latest iphone later .
expectations are `` sky-high '' the report says and apple risks losing ground if those expectations are not met .
on its front page the financial times reports on the record hit by us shares on monday .
the ft says investors were relieved that hurricane irma changed direction at the last minute , sparing the state of florida even more damage .
the business section of the times looks at the plunge in shares of ultimate products , the owner of russell hobbs and other brands .
it points out that the firm only listed six months ago and at the time the co-founders took almost £ 37m out of the company .
and a of keira knightley features in most of the business pages - she was among the celebrities at a charity event at brokers bgc in the city .

documents.title: asian smartphone makers jostle for attention
text: smartphone firms in asia are making noise ahead of apple 's big iphone reveal later on tuesday .
samsung said pre-orders of its latest premium smartphone galaxy note 8 , which goes on sale on friday , are the highest so far for its note series .
china 's xiaomi has also muscled in .
the firm unveiled its mi mix 2 smartphone featuring a 6-inch screen in beijing on monday .
xiaomi - along with huawei , oppo and vivo - are the biggest players in china , a market in which apple is trying hard to gain ground .

documents.title: look ahead to inflation
text: later on tuesday morning , we 'll discover how much inflation has grown - or slowed - in august .
the office for national statistics will release figures at 9:30 .
in july , the consumer price measure of inflation rose at 2.6 % compared to the same month last year .

documents.title: the northern rock crisis remembered
text: wake up to money looks back at the northern rock failure ten years ago .
the show speaks to veronica craig , who worked for the bank for 30 years .
she was there the day queues formed outside the bank , as people feared for its future .
`` i thought people were just panicking , '' she said .
she spent to the day talking to people in the queue : `` do n't worry my money is here , '' she told them .
for staff it was very sad she said , most had taken their bonuses in the form of shares , which then collapsed in value .
author: BBC Radio 5 live
